comment.label_en: An Instance is a rule to determine which attributes are Restricted Editable. Multiple instances can apply to a document.

combo.assistance_dql: select rse_model_name from rse_model order by rse_model_name
select rse_patterns from rse_model where rse_model_name = '$value(rse_model_name)' order by rse_patterns

comment.label_en: Specifying an “Applicable Doctype” will limit the instance to that doctype (subtypes not included). Leaving blank will utilize the doctype set in the model and its subtypes.

list.assistance_dql: select r_type_name from dmi_type_info where any r_supertype in (select rse_doctype from rse_model where rse_model_name = '$value(rse_model_name)') order by r_type_name

comment.label_en: If an attribute is used in “Pattern values for this instance”, specify the attribute conditions below. Values must be delimited with a pipe, e.g. |value|value| (limit 1000 characters).

combo.assistance_dql: select rse_pattern_attributes from rse_model where rse_model_name = '$value(rse_model_name)'

comment.label_en:
If the same attribute is used in multiple instances, the least restrictive condition is used. Values must be delimited with a pipe, e.g. |value|value| for “Valid States”.
​

combo.assistance_dql: select distinct attr_name from dm_type where name in (select rse_doctypes from rse_instance where r_object_id = '$value(r_object_id)') union select distinct attr_name from dm_type where name = (select rse_doctype from rse_model where rse_model_name ='$value(rse_model_name)') order by 1
SELECT generator_name FROM lss_sec_group_gen WHERE folder('/Security/Group Generator') order by generator_name
